page.title: 06THE RIVER WELLAND
page.content: Situated at the end of the {Coronation Channel}and the{River {Welland}are sluise gates. They form part of the drainage system around Spalding so that the low land will not flood. The{River Welland}is tidal and it is necerary to keep the river level at a manageable level so that the town and surrounding area does not flood. {Spalding}town was flooded completely in 1947. In 1953 the { {Coronation Channel}was built which is used as a by-pass for the river water around the and a means of containing high levels of water in{River}caused through a conbination of high rainfall and high tides. Since 1947 only one part of the{River}has flooded and this happened near the sluice gates in 1958 and 1978. Since 1978 major improvements have been made in this area to control the level of the water
